name: Title Color Match
description: A modification of GradientLogoTitleCard that includes the option to auto-select font color based on logo color.
This card will also automatically crop off extraneous transparent space from around the logo.

supported_extras.name: Gradient Omission
supported_extras.description: Whether to omit the gradient overlay

name: SciFi
description: A multi-overlay card designed to look like a heads up display.
Intended for use in Science Fiction series.

supported_extras.name: Trailing Underscore
supported_extras.description: Whether to add a trailing underscore (_) to the title text

supported_extras.name: Overlay Bottom Color
supported_extras.description: The color of the overlay's bottom layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Top Color
supported_extras.description: The color of overlay's top layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Middle Color
supported_extras.description: The color of the overlay's middle layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Rectangle Color
supported_extras.description: The color of the overlay rectangles

supported_extras.name: Overlay Base Alpha
supported_extras.description: The transparency of the black surrounding layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Bottom Alpha
supported_extras.description: The transparency of the bottom layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Top Alpha
supported_extras.description: The transparency of the top layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Middle Alpha
supported_extras.description: The transparency of the middle layer

supported_extras.name: Overlay Rectangles Alpha
supported_extras.description: The transparency of the overlay rectangles

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Color
supported_extras.description: The color of the episode text

supported_extras.name: Text Stroke Color
supported_extras.description: The color of the text stroke

name: Blacklist
description: Title Card intended for the 'The Blacklist' television series
This Card features a prominent title and a customizable 'blacklist number' beneath the title.
The default Font for this card is a modified version of Helvetica.

name: Tinted Frame Plus
description: A combination of the TintedFrameTitleCard and the StandardTitleCard for the best of both worlds.
It has many of the same extras you can pass to tinted frame, but it adds the episode title text above the bottom frame element (this is not modifiable).
The top element will default to logo now, and title is no longer an option (as it is always shown above the bottom element).

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Color
supported_extras.description: Color of the season and episode text
supported_extras.tooltip: Default is to match the Font color.

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Font
supported_extras.description: Font to use for the season and episode text

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Font Size
supported_extras.description: Size adjustment for the season and episode text

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Vertical Shift
supported_extras.description: Additional vertical shift to apply to the season and episode text. Default is <v>0</v>.

supported_extras.name: Separator Character
supported_extras.description: Character that separates the season and episode text

supported_extras.name: Frame Color
supported_extras.description: Color of the frame edges
supported_extras.tooltip: Default is to match the Font color.

supported_extras.name: Frame Width
supported_extras.description: Width of the frame
supported_extras.tooltip: Number ≥<v>0</v>. Default is <v>3</v>. Unit is pixels.

supported_extras.name: Top Element
supported_extras.description: Which element to display on the top of the frame
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>index</v> to display the season and episode text, <v>logo</v> to display the logo, or <v>omit</v> to not display anything. Default is <v>logo</v>.

supported_extras.name: Middle Element
supported_extras.description: Which element to display in the middle of the frame
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>logo</v> to display the logo, or <v>omit</v> to not display anything. Default is <v>omit</v>.

supported_extras.name: Bottom Element
supported_extras.description: Which element to display on the bottom of the frame
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>index</v> to display the season and episode text, <v>logo</v> to display the logo, or <v>omit</v> to not display anything. Default is <v>index</v>.

supported_extras.name: Logo Size
supported_extras.description: Scalar for how much to scale the size of the logo element

supported_extras.name: Edge Blurring
supported_extras.description: Whether to blur the edges around the frame

name: White Text Broadcast
description: Card based on Wdvh's White Text Absolute card, using the same format, but has the season number included in the episode text.

name: Star Wars (Title Only)
description: A variation of the standard Star Wars Card for Shows like Obi-Wan Kenobi that use Part/Chapter and similar as episode titles.
This card also uses a modified star gradient so that more of the left side of the image is visible.

name: White Text Standard
description: Modification of the Standard Card Type.
This Card uses a different font, smaller text size, and the episode title is positioned lower than the Standard Card Type.

supported_extras.name: Separator Character
supported_extras.description: Character to separate the season and episode text

name: Retro
description: Card type featuring a VHS/Camcorder inspired overlay.
The 'Play' button can be set to 'Rewind' and the image greyscaled when the item has been played.

supported_extras.name: Black & White Override
supported_extras.description: Override the Black & White modification
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>bw</v>, or <v>color</v> to force the black and white or color effects.

supported_extras.name: Style Override
supported_extras.description: Override the play/rewind style
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>play</v> or <v>rewind</v> to force that respective style.

name: Slim
description: Card type closely following the Standard Title Card but with slimmed down margins to save space.

supported_extras.name: Gradient Omission
supported_extras.description: Whether to omit the gradient overlay from this Card
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>True</v> or <v>False</v>. If <v>True</v>, text may appear less legible on brighter images.

name: Dawn
description: Produce TitleCards with left, centered or right aligned text on the bottom.
Optional CRT TV overlay for shows like Stranger Things with a retro theme.

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Vertical Shift
supported_extras.description: Vertical Shift for Episode Text
supported_extras.tooltip:
Additional vertical shift to apply to the season and episode text. Default is 0.
If multi-line issues, problem fonts may be fixed by Fix vertical metrics at https://transfonter.org/

supported_extras.name: Title Text Horizontal Shift
supported_extras.description: Horizontal shift for the title text
supported_extras.tooltip: Horizontal shift to apply to title text to align with episode text. Default is <v>0</v>.

supported_extras.name: Stroke Text Color
supported_extras.description: Color to use for the episode & title text stroke

supported_extras.name: Separator Character
supported_extras.description: Character to separate season and episode text

supported_extras.name: Horizontal Alignment
supported_extras.description: Horizontal alignment of text

supported_extras.name: CRT TV Overlay
supported_extras.description: CRT TV Overlay Toggle

supported_extras.name: CRT TV Watched/Unwatched Overlay
supported_extras.description: CRT TV Overlay Watched-Status Toggle
supported_extras.tooltip: Whether to change the CRT overlay with the watched status of the Episode. Either <v>True</v> or <v>False</v>. Default is <v>False</v>. Will only work if the CRT TV Overlay Toggle is enabled.

supported_extras.name: Gradient Omission
supported_extras.description: Whether to omit the gradient overlay
supported_extras.tooltip:
Either True or False. Set to False if you have trouble reading text on brighter images.
Default is True.

name: Horizon
description: Produce TitleCards with left or right aligned centered text with an optional symbol similar to those found on MediUX.
Optional CRT TV overlay for shows like Stranger Things with a retro theme.

supported_extras.name: Episode Text Vertical Shift
supported_extras.description: Vertical Shift for Episode Text
supported_extras.tooltip:
Additional vertical shift to apply to the season and episode text. Default is 0.
If multi-line issues, problem fonts may be fixed by fix vertical metrics at https://transfonter.org/.

supported_extras.name: Stroke Text Color
supported_extras.description: Color to use for the episode & title text stroke

supported_extras.name: Separator Character
supported_extras.description: Character to separate season and episode text

supported_extras.name: Horizontal Alignment
supported_extras.description: Horizontal alignment of the text and symbol

supported_extras.name: Symbol
supported_extras.description: Add a custom symbol behind the text
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>acolyte</v>, <v>ahsoka</v>, <v>andor</v>, <v>bobafett<v>, <v>mandalorian</v>, <v>obiwan</v>, or <v>witcher</v> to use a built-in symbol, or <v>logo</v> to use the Series logo.

supported_extras.name: CRT TV Overlay
supported_extras.description: CRT TV Overlay Toggle

supported_extras.name: CRT TV Watched/Unwatched Overlay
supported_extras.description: CRT TV Overlay Watched-Status Toggle
supported_extras.tooltip: Whether to change the CRT overlay with the watched status of the Episode. Either <v>True</v> or <v>False</v>. Default is <v>False</v>. Will only work if the CRT TV Overlay Toggle is enabled.

supported_extras.name: Gradient Omission
supported_extras.description: Whether to omit the gradient overlay
supported_extras.tooltip: Either <v>True</v> or <v>False</v>. Set to <v>False</v> if you have trouble reading text on brighter images. Default is <v>True</v>.

supported_extras.name: Alignment Overlay
supported_extras.description: Alignment Overlay Toggle
supported_extras.tooltip: Enable an alignment overlay to help assist adjusting offsets for misaligned custom fonts. The overlay has guiding lines every 10 pixels. Either <v>True</v> or <v>False</v>. Default is <v>False</v>.
